intro: Macrocentrum yaracuyense, commonly known as the Yaracuyense spurge, is a flowering plant native to Venezuela. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant has smooth, succulent leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
